sdkGuide.configAndroidTip1: 1. Switch to the Project view in Android Studio to see your project root directory.
sdkGuide.configAndroidTip2: 2. Move your downloaded {{fileName}} file into the “raw” directory.
sdkGuide.setupSDKDesc: You need to configure the SDK with default information before using it.

sdkGuide.androidStep2: Step 2: Initialize in the Application onCreate() method to use the SDK.

sdkGuide.iosAddLib: 1. We use Swift Package Manager to distribute clickstream iOS SDK. To start adding the clickstream Library to your iOS project, open your project in Xcode and
sdkGuide.iosEnterRepo1: 2. Enter the Clickstream Library for Swift GitHub repo URL
sdkGuide.iosEnterRepo2: You'll see the Clickstream Library for Swift repository rules into the search bar, for which version of Clickstream you want Swift Package Manager to install. Choose Up to Next Major Version, then click Add Package.
sdkGuide.iosDownloadJson: 3. Download your {{fileName}} file, and paste it your project root folder.
sdkGuide.iosInitSDKDesc: Once you have configured the parameters, you need to initialize it in the AppDelegate application() method to use the SDK.
sdkGuide.webInstallSDKDesc: Please use npm or a module bundler to install the Clickstream SDK.
sdkGuide.webSDKSetupDesc: Add the initialize code to your app's root entry point, for example index.js/app.tsx in React or main.ts in Vue/Angular.
sdkGuide.flutterSDKSetupDesc: Copy your configuration code from your clickstream solution web console, the configuration code should look like as follows. You can also manually add this code snippet and replace the values of appId and endpoint after you registered app to a data pipeline in the Clickstream Analytics solution console.
